references.A94PET04NAUS: Peterjohn, B.G., J.R. Sauer, and W.A. Link. 1994. The 1992 and 1993 summary of the North American Breeding Bird Survey. Bird Populations 2:46-61.
references.N97JON01NAUS: Jones, A.L., and P.D. Vickery. 1997. Conserving grassland birds:managing agricultural lands including hayfields, crop fields, and pastures for grassland birds. Massachusetts Audubon Society, Lincoln, MA.
references.B58BEN01NAUS: Bent, A.C. 1958. Life histories of North American blackbirds, orioles, tanagers, and their allies. U.S. National Museum Bulletin 211. Washington, DC.
references.B86HIL01NAUS: Hilty, S.L., and W.L. Brown. 1986. A guide to the birds of Colombia. Princeton University Press, Princeton, New Jersey. 836 pp.
references.B57LAN01NAUS: Lanyon, W. E. 1957. The comparative biology of the meadowlarks (STURNELLA) in Wisconsin. Nuttall. 66 pp.
references.B96SLI01NCGP: Skutch,  A.F. 1996. Orioles, blackbirds, and their kin. A natural history. Tuscon: University of Arizona Press. 291p.
references.B79HAR01NAUS: Harrison, H.H. 1979. A field guide to western birds' nests. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston. 279 pp.
references.A68SCH01SEGP: Schoener, T. W. 1968. Sizes of feeding territories among birds. Ecology.  49 (1):123-141.
references.B90DRO01NAUS: Droege, S., and J.R. Sauer. 1990. North American Breeding Bird Survey, annual summary, 1989. U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Biological Report 90(8). 22 pp.
references.B92HAM01NAUS: Hamel, P. B. 1992. The land manager's guide to the birds of the south. The Nature Conservancy, Chapel Hill, North Carolina. 367 pp + several appendices.
references.B80POT01NAUS: Potter, E. F., J. F. Parnell, and R. P. Teulings. 1980. Birds of the Carolinas. Univ. North Carolina Press, Chapel Hill. 408 pp.
references.B83AOU01USGP: American Ornithologists' Union (AOU). 1983. Check-list of North American Birds, 6th edition. Allen Press, Inc., Lawrence, Kansas. 877 pp.
references.B90SIB02NAUS: Sibley, C.G., and B.L. Monroe. 1990. Distribution and taxonomy of birds of the world. Yale University Press, New Haven, Connecticut. xxiv + 1111 pp.
references.B92SIM01NCGP: Simpson M.B Jr. 1992. Birds of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Chapel Hill and London: University of North Carolina Press.
references.B80TER01NAUS: Terres, J.K. 1980. The Audubon Society encyclopedia of North American birds. Alfred A. Knopf, New York.
references.B97NIC01NCGP: Nicholson CP. 1997. Atlas of the breeding birds of Tennessee. Knoxville: University of Tennessee Press.
references.B92EHR01NAUS: Ehrlich, P.R., D.S. Dobkin, and D. Wheye. 1992. Birds in jeopardy:the imperiled and extinct birds of the United States and Canada, including Hawaii and Puerto Rico. Stanford University Press, Stanford, California. 259 pp.
references.A88KNA01NAUS: Knapton, R. W. 1988. Nesting success in higher for polygynously mated females than for monogamously mated females in the eastern meadowlark. Auk 105:325-329.
references.A89DIC01NAUS: Dickerman, R. W. 1989. Notes on STURNELLA MAGNA in South America with a description of a new subspecies. Bull. Br. Ornothol. Club 109:160-162.
references.B89RID02NAUS: Ridgely, R.S., and G. Tudor. 1989. The birds of South America. Vol. 1. The Oscine passerines. Univ. Texas Press, Austin. 516 pp.
references.B89STI01NAUS: Stiles, F.G., and A.F. Skutch. 1989. A guide to the birds of Costa Rica. Comstock Publ. Associates, Cornell University Press, Ithaca, New York. 511 pp.
references.B78HAR01NAUS: Harrison, C. 1978. A field guide to the nests, eggs and nestlings of North American birds. Collins, Cleveland, Ohio.
